bestBHT.bht: John the Baptist's success in awakening the anticipation of the Messiah's immediate appearing and the reverence he commanded due to his character suggests that some people questioned if he was the Christ. With the imagery of the fan in his hand, John symbolizes the process of purging and refining, revealing his role in distinguishing between genuine believers and the rest.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Showing both how successful he had been in awakening the expectation of Messiah's immediate appearing.
The high estimation, and even reverence, which his own character commanded.
Marvin Vincent: Fan - floor - purge. See on Matthew 3:12.
John Gill: Whose fan is in his hand,....

bhtAttempts.bht: John the Baptist is depicted in Luke 3:17 as someone who was able to inspire and ignite the anticipation of the arrival of the Messiah. His character was esteemed and revered by many, leading some to speculate whether he was the long-awaited Christ. The metaphor of the fan in his hand suggests that John played a role in separating the wheat from the chaff, purging and refining people's hearts. (Matthew 3:12)

John the Baptist was successful in arousing the anticipation of the immediate appearance of the Messiah. His own character commanded great respect and reverence, leading some to question if he was the Christ. The imagery of the fan in his hand signifies his role in separating the true believers from the false, purging and purifying their hearts.

John the Baptist's ability to stir the expectation of the imminent arrival of the Messiah is evident in Luke 3:17. His esteemed character elevated him to a position of high regard and reverence, causing some to question if he himself was the Christ. The use of the fan metaphor highlights John's role in separating the wheat from the chaff, symbolizing his role in purging and refining the hearts of those who encountered his message.

John the Baptist's success in awakening the anticipation of the Messiah's immediate appearing and the reverence he commanded due to his character suggests that some people questioned if he was the Christ. With the imagery of the fan in his hand, John symbolizes the process of purging and refining, revealing his role in distinguishing between genuine believers and the rest.

John the Baptist effectively aroused the expectation of the Messiah's imminent arrival due to his influential character, prompting some to speculate if he himself was the Christ. The metaphor of the fan in his hand symbolizes his role in the separation and purification of individuals, akin to a process of purging the undesirable from the desirable.
